docs.title: LaTeX Math Support
docs.text:
LaTeX math is supported using MathJax.

Inline math looks like \(f(x) = x^2\). The input for this is $f(x) = x^2$. Use $...$.

For a block of math, use $$...$$ on separate lines

$$
F(x) = \int^a_b \frac{1}{2}x^4
$$

gives

\[ F(x) = \int^a_b \frac{1}{2}x^4 \]

LaTeX math is supported using MathJax.

docs.title: Mermaid Diagrams (English)
docs.text: • Español: Esta página no está traducida al español.

docs.title: Mermaid diagrams
docs.text:
Here's the example from MkDocs Material documentation: 

graph LR
  A[Start] --> B{Error?};
  B -->|Yes| C[Hmm...];
  C --> D[Debug];
  D --> B;
  B ---->|No| E[Yay!];

docs.title: Text Formatting
docs.text: • Español: Esta página no está traducida al español.

docs.title: Text Formatting
docs.text:
You can have lists like this

  • first
  • second
  • third

Or checklist lists to

  • Get
  • things
  • done

Also, get highlights and strikethroughs as above (similar to Obsidian).

More formatting options for your webpage here. (but not compatible with Obsidian)

docs.title: What is the logic behind our influencers games?
What is the logic behind our influencers games?
docs.text:
The basic interaction of the users begin with the landing page or direct access to the game. Its logic is as follows:

sequenceDiagram
    autonumber
    participant User as User
    participant Front as Frontend
    participant Next as NextJS
    User->>Front: I want to access this page
    alt Public page
        Front->>Next: Request
        Next->>Front: Response
    else Private page
        Front->>Next: Do I have a valid session?
        alt Yes
            create participant Back as Backend
            Next->Back: Please validate
            destroy Back
            Back->>Next: Validation response
            Next->>Front: Response
        else No
            Next->>Front: No, login
        end
    end
    Note over Front, Next: Render page response
        Front->>User: Page
